ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I feel like I learned nothing in this class. Everything I learned I had to teach myself from the textbook and from online videos.
Basic statistics and statistical tests.
I gained the skills of basic Stata commands that I was able to use to analyze data. Also, I learned the basic fundamentals to statistics to aid me in further advanced data science classes.
Basic statistical analysis.
Strong foundational knowledge of statistics and ability to use Stata program.
Understanding how to analyze sociological research and use Stata.
Basics of statistics. It was very much a review of AP stats.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: In almost every single class there were mistakes in the slides that he always said he would correct but never did. This made studying incredibly stressful because I didn't know whether I could trust the slides. The class was so useless that even our professor said it was optional for people to show up to class. He would have a fifteen minute break in the middle of class which is excessively long especially for a morning class. All of the slides were copy and pasted from our text book--which made it even more confusing how there were so many mistakes in the slides.

Strengths: moves slow which can be helpful if you're not confident in the subject, low workload, only meets once a week; 
Weaknesses: expectations sometimes unclear/confusing

The strengths of this course is the low stress, low workload, and small seminar environment. It allows you to go at your own pace and explore the topics further as you do not feel pressured or weighed down by too many assignments or heavily weighted exams. The weaknesses of this course is that it could feel a bit unorganized, the schedule would sometimes need changing and instructions weren't clear sometimes, but personally, the strengths outweighed the weaknesses completely.
The course covered interesting topics and made statistics very approachable. It could be improved by being better organized.
Flexibility of class attendance was helpful. Computer lab was also beneficial, and it was nice to have so much extra help/office hours availability around due dates and exams.
It was a very easy course - I think increasing the material content could help.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely not. I was told to take this class for my major, and I have regretted it so much. I would encourage other students to take any other class that is not taught by this professor.
Yes if you're looking for an easy QR, but maybe better off taking a different statistics course
If you want to gain a basic understanding of some statistical concepts used in sociology. I thought I would learn more Stata  dont expect much of that at all.

I would recommend this course to another student. If you want something more intensive, then I would say look elsewhere, but if you want a good working understanding of basic Stata language and statistics and are looking for something for low-stress, low-pressure then I recommend this course.
If a student struggles with math and is looking for an easy introduction to statistics, I would recommend that they take this course.
Yes if they have no prior knowledge of statistics and want an introduction or want to take a QR class as someone who doesnt usually enjoy math.
Yes, its an easy course that helps to refresh your knowledge on stats.
